meanings.definition: An official order or commission to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's mandate was to assign homework every day.
meanings.sent2: The government issued a mandate requiring everyone to wear masks in public places.
meanings.sent3: The cat's mandate to catch mice was taken very seriously by the lazy feline.
meanings.sent4: The king's mandate to build a grand palace echoed throughout the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The company's mandate for employees to attend training sessions was strictly enforced.

meanings.definition: The authority to carry out a policy or course of action.
meanings.sent1: The manager had the mandate to make decisions for the team.
meanings.sent2: The president's mandate allowed him to implement new laws.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to believe he had the mandate to guard the house from all intruders.
meanings.sent4: The captain's mandate to steer the ship safely guided them through the storm.
meanings.sent5: The principal's mandate to maintain discipline in the school kept order among the students.

meanings.sent1: The coach's mandate was for the players to give their best effort.
meanings.sent2: The sergeant's mandate was to march the troops in formation.
meanings.sent3: The robot followed its programming mandate to clean the entire house.
meanings.sent4: The conductor's mandate to start the concert signaled the musicians to begin playing.
meanings.sent5: The chef's mandate to use fresh ingredients resulted in delicious meals for the customers.
